Description.val:
The FY 2020 funding request was reduced by $10.000 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances. 

This budget provides funding for the in service LPD 17 class program support equipment. Previous funding for LPD 17 class support equipment (FY12 and earlier) was provided under line item OPN 0981, Items Less Than $5 Million. Funding is required to upgrade mission critical electronics and Hull Mechanical & Engineering (HM&E) systems including the Engineering Control Systems (ECS), Ship Control Systems (SCS), Degaussing Systems, Shipboard Wide-Area Network (SWAN), commercial software products for ECS, SCS, Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C4ISR) and Administrative Communications.

[P40A / CJ010 - Schoolhouse TTE]: CJ010 - SCHOOLHOUSE TTE
Funding for Schoolhouse Technical Training Equipment (TTE) is for the infrastructure and equipment to set up the schoolhouses for multiple systems such as ECS and SCS 60Hz and Ship Service Diesel Generators (SSDG). The schoolhouses will provide critical training to sailors in operation and maintenance of those systems.

[P40A / CJ020 - Shore Based Spares]: CJ020 SHORE BASED SPARES
Shore-Based Spares are critical long lead time items that are staged shore-side in the event of a catastrophic failure on an operational ship.  These spares must be periodically replenished as assets are utilized.  Furthermore, as the LPD 17 Class continues to introduce new ships (additional) to the fleet, the number of spare requirements increases as additional items are added to the spares list to support newer shipboard configurations.

[P40A / CJ080 Conjunctive HM&E AIT]: CJ080 CONJUNCTIVE HM&E ALTERATIONS
Conjunctive HM&E Alterations includes design integration, equipment procurement, recurring equipment engineering, equipment integration, and Integrated Logistics Services (ILS).

[P3A / CJ030 - HW/SW Obsolescence]: CJ030, CJ032 LPD 17 Hardware/Software HW/SW Obsolescence effort addresses critical hardware obsolescence and technology refreshment issues and supporting class upgrades focused on increased capability and reliability. Funding will support procurement of hardware and software changes to the systems listed:
-Command Information Display System (CIDS) 23TV, Replace projectors with Light Emitting Diode (LED) Projectors
-Rudder Angle Indicator
-Engineering Control Systems (ECS) - Windows XP and Windows 10 upgrades
-Ship Control Systems (SCS) - Windows XP and Windows 10 upgrades/SCS Tech Refresh, Digital Rudder Angle Display Information System (DRADIS)
-Fire Detection System Upgrade Phase 1
-HM&E Network - HM&E Network Upgrades
-Wire-free Portable Communication System (WPCS) - Uninterrupted Power Supply (UPS) Upgrade, Low Power Amplifier Upgrade, Main Site Upgrade.
-27TV - 27TV System Upgrade
-Advanced Fire and Smoke Sensor System (AFSS) - AFSS System Upgrade.
-Integrated Voice Communication System (IVCS) - IVCS system upgrades (local cutout switches, AFT lookout communication mod, obsolete terminal replacement, FWD/AFT Keyswitched Integrated Terminal Equipment (KITE)), Software version 7.2.2
-1MC Announcing System - Digital Microphone Control Station
-Navigational Data Distribution System - Reduction & Sustainment
-Damage Control Action Management System (DCAMS) - Upgrade to Advanced Damage Control System (ADCS)
-Boundary Defense Cyber Security hardening

[P3A - 2 / CJ040 HM&E Electrical Modifications]: CJ040 HM&E ELECTRICAL MODIFICATIONS HM&E Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on electrical systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Electrical Modifications include:
SWAN UPS- Space Based UPS Reduction

[P3A - 3 / CJ050 - HM&E Survivability Modifications]: CJ050 HM&E SURVIVABILITY MODIFICATIONS HM&E Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on HM&E systems (impacting ship survivability) and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Survivability Modifications include:
-Composite Ventilation Louvers and Screens.

[P3A - 4 / CJ060 - HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications]: CJ060, CJ061, CJ062, CJ063 HM&E MECHANICAL/AUXILIARY MODIFICATIONS HM&E Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Mechanical/ Auxiliary Modifications include:
-MIDE Bulkhead Shaft Seal
-Helo Hangar Door Control Modifications
-Vacuum Collection, Holding & Transfer (VCHT) Ejector Pump PLC Upgrade
-2nd Pass Reverse Osmosis (RO) Unit Upgrade, RO Unit Potable Water Electrolytic Disinfectant Generator (EDG) Recirculation Capability
-Aviation Maintenance Bridge Crane Replacement
-Knuckleboom Crane Improvements
-Geislinger Coupling Improvements
-Scullery Improvements
-Gaylord System Improvements
-Branch Piping Modifications
-Titanium valve replacement
-Common Fuel Rail upgrades

[P3A - 5 / CJ070 SWAN-CANES Integration]: CJ070 SWAN-CANES Integration
The results of the Shipboard Wide Area Network (SWAN) / Consolidated Afloat Networks and Enterprise Services (CANES) study directed the replacement of the C4I capability of the LPD 17 Class SWAN with CANES and the conversion of the non-C4I SWAN into a new HM&E Network (mini SWAN).   SWAN funding is required to field the new HM&E Network in support of the CANES  installation.  In addition, funding is required to sustain the legacy SWAN, while the LPD 17 Class ships await the CANES/HM&E Network back fit installation.   SWAN serves as the backbone of the LPD 17 class and funding is necessary to address obsolescence, reliability issues, performance concerns, emergent Fleet requirements including enabling Cryptologic Log On (CLO), removing unsupported software, replacing aging obsolete network hardware (e.g., servers and core switches), and maintaining the Information Assurance posture of the Common Operating Environment (COE).   This funding is vital to ensure the LPD 17 Class ships can combat the evolving cyber threat.

Name.@footnote: CJ080- CONJUNCTIVE HM&E ALTERATIONS   Advanced Planning Long Lead Time Material in support of follow-on CNO availability installations.

Due to changes in CNO Availabilities, FY19 procurements and subsequent FY20 installations originally budgeted (PB19) for a quantity of (8) installations have been deferred by three years. The FY19 procurements will now be installed in FY23.  HW/SW Obsolescence (CJ030) includes funding for procurement and installation of equipment to correct critical obsolescence issues on LPD17 Class mission systems. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of    "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized. In FY19, there are (15) total kits being procured for installation during (4) FY20 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (3 kit), LPD 18 (1 kit), LPD 25 (8 kit), and LPD 26 (3 kit). In FY20, there are (7) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY21 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (3 kits), LPD 22 (3 kits), and LPD 27 (1 kit). In FY21, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (2) FY22 CNO Availabilities on LPD 21 (2 kits), and LPD 23 (1 kit). In FY22, there are (5) total kits being procured for installation during (4) FY23 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (1 kit), LPD 20 (2 kits), LPD 24 (1 kit), and LPD 26 (1 kit). In FY23, there are (6) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY24 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (1 kit), LPD 25 (1 kit), and LPD 27 (4 kits). In FY24, there is (1) total kit being procured for installation during (1) FY25 CNO Availability on LPD 26    (1 kit).    DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.  The program has experienced longer production lead times than previously budgeted.  All production lead times for FY19 and follow have been adjusted to support on-time delivery of materials.

Description.val:
HW/SW Obsolescence (CJ030) includes funding for procurement and installation of equipment to correct critical obsolescence issues on LPD17 Class mission systems. Resolves operational and obsolescence issues.  Replaces current split controllers, resolves rack cooling, modifies loud speaker cable plant, and provides commonality and system architecture and hardware.

[HW/SW Obsolescence] HW/SW Obsolescence effort addresses hardware obsolescence/technology refreshment issues, and class upgrades focused on increased capabilities, force protection, and safety. Funding will support procurement of hardware and software changes to the systems listed:
-Command Information Display System (CIDS) 23TV - HW refresh and upgrade to Windows 10
-Rudder Angle Indicator
-Ship Control Systems (SCS) - Windows XP and Windows 10 upgrade/SCS Tech Refresh, Digital Rudder Angle Display Information System (DRADIS)
-Fire Detection System Upgrade Phase 1
-Wire-free Portable Communication System (WPCS) - Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) Upgrade, Low Power Amplifier Upgrade
-27TV - 27TV Low Channel Pier Cable Blockage improvement
-Advanced Fire and Smoke Sensor System (AFSS) - AFSS System Upgrade
-Integrated Voice Communication System (IVCS)- IVCS system upgrades (local cutout switches, AFT lookout communication mod, obsolete terminal replacement, FWD/AFT KITE), Software version 7.2.2.
-1MC Announcing System - Digital Microphone Control Station 1MC improvements
-Navigational Data Distribution System (NDDS) - Sustainment and Reduction
-Damage Control Action Management Software (DCAMS) - Upgrade to Advanced Damage Control System
-Boundary Defense Cyber Security Hardening

Name.@footnote: HM&E Electrical Modification (CJ040) includes funding for procurement and installation of equipment to upgrade shipboard electrical systems to a more sustainable, reliable configuration on LPD17 Class ships. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single CNO Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized. In FY19, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY20 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (1 kit), LPD 25 (1 kit), and LPD 26 (1 kit). In FY20, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY21 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (1 kit), LPD 22 (1 kit), and LPD 27 (1 kit). In FY21, there is (1) total kit being procured for installation (1) FY22 CNO Availability on LPD 21 (1 kit). In FY22, there is (1) total kit being procured for installation during (1) FY23 CNO Availability on LPD 20 (1 kit).  Funding supports safety and capability improvements in the design of the Space Based UPS. This results in a more robust system configuration, requiring additional cable runs, load center tie-in, battery placements, and industrial work efforts.  DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.  The program has experienced longer production lead times than previously budgeted.  All production lead times for FY19 and follow have been adjusted to support on-time delivery of materials.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: HM&E Electrical Upgrades

Description.val:
HM&E Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on electrical systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. HM&E Electrical Modifications include:
SWAN UPS - Space Based Uninterruptable Power Supply (UPS) Reduction

The installation fielding plan for this cost code has been adjusted to align with Consolidated Afloat Networks and Enterprise Services (CANES) installations aboard LPD 17 Class ships. This alignment has been completed to reduce the operational burden on ship's force, and reduce re-work during CANES installations.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: CJ060 HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications

Description.val:
HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications (CJ060) includes funding for procurement and installation of equipment to support upgrades of shipboard mechanical/auxiliary systems to a more sustainable, reliable configuration on LPD17 Class ships. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single CNO Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized.

HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Modifications include:

-Helo Hangar Door Control Modifications
-Vacuum Collection, Holding & Transfer (VCHT) Ejector Pump PLC Upgrade
-2nd Pass Reverse Osmosis (RO) Unit Upgrade, RO Unit Potable Water Electrolytic Disinfectant Generator (EDG) Recirculation Capability
-Aviation Maintenance Bridge Crane Replacement
-Geislinger Coupling Improvements
-Scullery Improvements

Name.@footnote: This mod has sharp fluctuations in procurement and installation unit cost due to the variations in equipment quantities and types of components that make up a shipset.  Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations.  Due to Type Commander (TYCOM) Integrated Class Maintenance Plan (ICMP) scheduling adjustments, CNO availabilities for LPD 17 Class have increased from once every 2 years to once every 3 years.  This has caused CANES and HM&E Network schedules to slip and SWAN sustainment modification quantities to increase.

Due to the acceleration of Consolidated Afloat Network Enterprise Services (CANES) installations on LPD 25 and LPD 26 originally budgeted (PB19) FY20 LPD 25 and FY22 LPD 26 procurements and subsequent FY21 LPD 25 and FY23 LPD 26 installations have been accelerated to FY19 procurements and to FY20 installations respectively.  These installations are conjunctive to the CANES installation. FY19 Conjunctive HM&E Alterations - CJ080 were reduced to support FY19 procurements. Accelerated installations include: LPD 25 - SWAN Removal, HM&E Network Conversion Mesh, SCDN Out of Band Management, SCDN Cybersecurity Enhancements; LPD 26 - SWAN Removal, HM&E Network Conversion Ring.  FY20 Availabilities: LPD 17 - Ship Control Data Network (SCDN) Out of Band Management; LPD 18 - SCDN Out of Band Management; LPD 20 - SWAN Compose 4.0.1, Windows 10 SHB, SWAN NIPRNET CLO, SWAN SIPRNET CLO, SWAN Next Generation Server; LPD 21 - SWAN Compose 4.0.1, Windows 10 SHB, SWAN NIPRNET CLO, SWAN SIPRNET CLO; LPD 25 - SWAN Removal, HM&E Network Conversion Mesh, SCDN Out of Band Management, SCDN Cybersecurity Enhancements; LPD 26 - SWAN Removal, HM&E Network Conversion Ring. FY21 Availabilities: LPD 19 - SWAN Removal, HM&E Network Conversion Ring; LPD 22 - SWAN Removal, HM&E Network Conversion Mesh, SCDN Out of Band Management, SCDN Cybersecurity Enhancements; LPD 27 - SWAN Removal, HM&E Network Conversion Ring. FY22 Availabilities: LPD 21 - SWAN Removal, HM&E Network Conversion Ring. FY23 Availabilities: LPD 20 - SWAN Removal, HM&E Network Conversion Ring.   The program has experienced longer production lead times than previously budgeted.  All production lead times for FY19 and follow have been adjusted to support on-time delivery of materials.

Description.val: [SWAN-CANES Integration] The results of the Shipboard Wide Area Network (SWAN) / Consolidated Afloat Networks and Enterprise Services (CANES) study directed the replacement of the C4I capability of the LPD 17 Class SWAN with CANES and the conversion of the non-C4I SWAN into a new HM&E Network (mini SWAN).   SWAN funding is required to field the new HM&E Network in support of the CANES  installation.  In addition, funding is required to sustain the legacy SWAN, while the LPD 17 Class ships await the CANES/HM&E Network back fit installation.   SWAN serves as the backbone of the LPD 17 class and funding is necessary to address obsolescence, reliability issues, performance concerns, emergent Fleet requirements including enabling Cryptologic Log On (CLO), removing unsupported software, replacing aging obsolete network hardware (e.g., servers and core switches), and maintaining the Information Assurance posture of the Common Operating Environment (COE).   This funding is vital to ensure the LPD 17 Class ships can combat the evolving cyber threat.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: WPCS Main Site Upgrades

Description.val:
NRE includes the following efforts:
FY20: Wireless Portable Communications System (WPCS) non-recurring engineering in support of hardware obsolescence, software upgrade to Microsoft Windows 10, and upgrades to the e-stop and fall protection of the main site.

[WPCS Main Site Upgrades] WIRELESS PORTABLE COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEM (WPCS) Hardware/Software (CJ030):  HW/SW Obsolescence effort addresses critical hardware obsolescence and technology refreshment issues and supporting class upgrades focused on increased capability and reliability. Funding will support procurement of hardware and software changes to the WPCS Main Site.

[Non-Recurring Engineering] NRE includes the following efforts:
FY20: Wireless Portable Communications System (WPCS) non-recurring engineering in support of hardware obsolescence, software upgrade to Microsoft Windows 10, and upgrades to the e-stop and fall protection of the main site.

Name.@footnote: CJ061 HM&E MECHANICAL/AUXILIARY MODIFICATIONS HM&E Modernization Titanium Valve Replacement Phase I funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized.  In FY17, there were a total of (2) kits procured in support of (2) FY18 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (1 kit) and LPD 22 (1 kit).  The material was delayed due to the manufacturer failing required shock and vibration testing, and therefore these installations were deferred. Installation will occur in FY21 for both LPD 19 (1 kit) and LPD 22 (1 kit).  DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Titanium Valve Replacement Phase 1

Name.@footnote: Due to LPD 20 operational commitments resulting in a reduction to the FY21 CNO Availability duration, an FY19 procurement has had the subsequent originally budgeted (PB19) FY21 installation for (1) kit deferred to FY23. The (1) kit for LPD 20 will now be installed in FY23 in a CNO Availability that has sufficient duration to support the installation.  HM&E MECHANICAL/AUXILIARY MODIFICATIONS HM&E Modernization, Titanium Valve Replacement Phase II funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized. In FY18, there were (3) total kits being procured for installation during (1) FY19 CNO Availability, (1) FY20 CNO Availability and (1) FY26 CNO availability on LPD 21 (1 kit for FY19), LPD 17 (1 kit for FY20), and LPD 18 (1 kit for FY26). In FY19, there are (2) total kits being procured for installation during (2) FY21 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (1 kit) and LPD 22 (1 kit). There are no FY22 CNO availabilities that would support associated procurements in FY20.  In FY21, there is (1) total kit being procured for installation during (1) FY23 CNO Availability on LPD 20 (1 kit). There are no FY24 CNO availabilities that would support associated procurements in FY22. There are no FY25 CNO availabilities that would support associated procurements in FY23.    DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.  All Phase II procurements have been moved to A-2 years prior to installation, vice A-1 year prior to installation, due to actual lead times encountered on previously procured ship sets. Once exception to this change is (1) kit being procured in FY18 for LPD 21 FY19 CNO Availability, which was procured at A-1 years. The procurement of (1) kit for LPD 21 FY19 CNO Availability has remained an A-1 year prior to installation procurement because funding was not available to accelerate the procurement once actual lead times were known.

[Titanium Valve Replacement Phase 1] TITANIUM VALVE REPLACEMENT (CJ061) Titanium Valve Replacement Phase I: Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. Funding will support Phase I of the Titanium valve replacement.

ModificationTitle.val: CJ062 HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Mods Knuckleboom Crane Improvements

Title.val: CJ062 HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Mods Knuckleboom Crane Improvements

Name.@footnote: Due to a delay in Non-Recurring Engineering, FY18 procurements and subsequent FY19 installations originally budgeted (PB18 and PB19) for a quantity of two (2) Knuckleboom Crane Improvements have been deferred by one year. The FY18 procurements will now be executed in FY19, and installed in FY20. The two (2) budgeted FY19 procurements in PB19 will be procured in FY19, and installed in FY21. All other procurements and installations have been adjusted to account for the delay in NRE.   HM&E MECHANICAL/AUXILIARY MODIFICATIONS HM&E Modernization Knuckleboom Crane Improvement funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns.  Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized. In FY19, there are (2) total kits being procured for installation during (2) FY20 CNO Availabilities on LPD 18 (1 kit) and LPD 25 (1 kit). In FY20, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY21 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (1 kit), LPD 22 (1 kit), and LPD 27 (1 kit).  In FY21, there are (2) total kits being procured for installation during (2) FY22 CNO Availabilities on LPD 21 (1 kit) and LPD 23 (1 kit). In FY22, there are (3) total kits being procured for installation during (3) FY23 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (1 kit), LPD 20 (1 kit), and LPD 24 (1 kit). There are no FY24 CNO availabilities that would support associated procurements in FY23.  In FY24, there is (1) total kit being procured for installation during (1) FY25 CNO Availability on LPD 26 (1 kit).   DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Knuckleboom Crane Improvement

Description.val:
[Knuckleboom Crane Improvement] KNUCKLEBOOM CRANE IMPROVEMENTS Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on mechanical and auxiliary systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. Funding will support boat and cargo crane safety upgrades.

[Non-Recurring Engineering]

ModificationTitle.val: CJ063 HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Mod Common Fuel Rail

Title.val: CJ063 HM&E Mechanical/Auxiliary Mod Common Fuel Rail

Name.@footnote: HM&E MECHANICAL/AUXILIARY MODIFICATIONS HM&E Modernization Common Fuel Rail (CFR) funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on Main Propulsion Diesel Engine (MPDE) systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. FY22 Installations: LPD 21 and LPD 23. FY23 Installations: LPD 17 and LPD 20. FY24 Installation: LPD 19. FY25 Installation: LPD 26.   Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) for the CFR was completed in FY18. The fielding plan for the CFR has been changed to reflect current funding capabilities based upon cost estimates at the completion of NRE.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Common Fuel Rail

Description.val: [Common Fuel Rail] FUEL INJECTION COMMON RAIL Modernization funding is provided to correct mission, safety and reliability issues on Main Propulsion Diesel Engine (MPDE) systems and ultimately resolve maintenance intensive system concerns. Funding will support developing and installing a high-pressure, electronically-controlled fuel injection rail system.

Name.@footnote: CYBER REQUIREMENT Modernization funding is provided to implement cyber resiliency principles, a Defense-in-Depth Functional Implementation Architecture (DFIA), Boundary Defense Capabilities and Situational Awareness tools. Shipsets of equipment vary in quantities and types of components each fiscal year and within a fiscal year. Each ship requires a different number of alterations to be installed, and these alteration packages vary in scope and cost based on individual ship configurations. A quantity of "1" represents a single "kit" intended for installation in one ship, in a single Chief of Naval Operations (CNO) Availability. Ships may be receiving more than 1 kit in a single availability based upon the fielding plan for the systems being modernized. In FY21, there are a total of (2) kits being procured in support of (2) FY22 CNO Availabilities on LPD 23 (1 kit) and LPD 28 (1 kit). In FY22, there are at total of (2) kits being procured in support of (2) FY23 CNO Availabilities on LPD 17 (1 kit) and LPD 24 (1) kit. In FY23, there are a total of (3) kits being procured in support of (3) FY24 CNO Availabilities on LPD 19 (1 kit), LPD 22 (1 kit), and LPD 25 (1 kit).  DSA costs will also vary by kit due to differences in scope and complexity, and first installation compared to follow-on installations.
